resources.string: This resource can help you decide what kind of medical care you might need for COVID\‑19.\n\nLet\'s all look out for each other by knowing our status, trying not to infect others, and reserving care for those in need.
You\'ll answer a few questions about symptoms, travel, and contact you’ve had with others.
Your answers will not be shared with Contacts Tracer or any Public Health Official without your permission.
By using this tool, you agree to its terms and that Contacts Tracer will not be liable for any harm relating to your use.
Recommendations provided by this tool do not constitute medical advice and should not be used to diagnose or treat medical conditions.
If this is an emergency, stop and call 911

•   Constant chest pain or pressure
    • \n
  •   Severe difficulty breathing
    • \n
  •   Severe shortness of breath
    • \n
  •   Severe, constant dizziness
    • \n
  •   Slurred speech
    • \n
  •   Extreme difficulty waking up
    • \n
  •   Any other life-threatening symptoms
How old is the person you\'re answering these questions for\?
Do you have any of these symptoms\?
Do you work or volunteer in a healthcare setting, or plan to in the next 2 weeks\?
Such as a hospital\, nursing home\, long\-term care facility, or first\-responder service
In the last 2 weeks, did you\:
Do you live in a care facility\?
Nursing home, assisted living or long-term care facility
Do you have any of these conditions\?
This tool is intended for people who are at least 18 years old
Visit the CDC site to get information about COVID‑19 and younger people.
Protect yourself and others by keeping a safe distance
Keep 6 feet of space between yourself and others outside of your home
Protect yourself and others by staying home
Tell them about your symptoms and ask about getting tested for COVID\‑19
Sustained loss of smell\, taste\, or appetite
Chronic lung disease (Such as COPD, emphysema)
Have close contact with someone who has COVID\‑19
Live in or visit a place where COVID\‑19 is widespread
Do your part and help stop the spread of COVID\-19
Contacts Tracer keeps you and your loved ones safe. We assist you to take the right move in combating COVID\-19 pandemic.
To protect those around you, Public Health Official may also ask you to share your data
Assist in the fight against COVID\-19 by turning Bluetooth on
People\-driven tracking and trackers to keep one another safe from those affected by the virus.
Your location data stays offline and is shared with a Public Health Official only when there\'s a potential risk.
We use Bluetooth signals to determine if you are near another Contacts Tracer user.\n\nThis proximity data is encrypted and stored locally on your device.
We\'ll contact you if you had close encounter with a COVID\-19 case.

I agree that a Public Health Official can use this phone number and the collected data in the case of a potential risk factor according to the Terms and Conditions to carry out epidemiological investigation.
We sent a verification code to phone number %s.
Verification code was automatically filled from the SMS.
Didn\'t receive a OTP? Start using the application and verify your Phone Number later.
You consent with the conditions of data processing is necessary to activate the application. Without your consent, the application cannot work properly.
Oops, something went wrong!. Try again later.
Please verify your phone number so that we can contact you when there\'s a potential risk.
In case you are tested positive, we will contact you using your phone number provided.
Data was already sent. You can send it again in %d minutes.

This is a list of signal measurements of nearby devices with Contacts Tracer in the past %d days. Data does not contain coordinates nor any other personal data. Data can only be sent to a Public Health Official with your consent.
You need to enable Bluetooth to make Contacts Tracer work correctly
You need to enable Location Services to make Contacts Tracer work correctly
You need to disable Battery Saver to make Contacts Tracer work correctly
Contacts Tracer is inactive. Don\'t forget to reactivate.
Contacts Tracer is active and anonymously monitoring nearby devices.
With Bluetooth disabled, Contacts Tracer cannot monitor your surroundings.\n\nEnable it by pressing \"Enable Bluetooth\".
Even though we don\'t use Location data, enable them in order for Bluetooth to work properly by using the button \"Enable Location Service\".

With Bluetooth and Location Services disabled, Contacts Tracer cannot monitor your surroundings.\n\nEven though we don\'t use Location data, please enable both services in order for Bluetooth to work properly by using the button \u201cEnable Permissions\".
Contacts Tracer is actively running in the background.\n
Contacts Tracer is inactive and is not collecting any data about your surroundings.\n\nActivate Contacts Tracer in order to monitor your surroundings. Remember to keep yourself and others safe.
Your device doesn\'t support Bluetooth LE
Contacts Tracer needs Bluetooth to function properly
Bluetooth is part of Location Services. That\'s why we ask for permission to use Location tracking after you press \"Enable\". Confirm both requests so that the application can function properly.
You are the only one who can upload the collected data, and only when asked to do so by a Public Health Official.
Enter your phone number that will be used by a Public Health Official only when there\'s a potential risk.
Verification code was not entered correctly.
Error contacting server. Check network connection.
Too many phone verification requests. You can try again in a couple of hours.
You cannot use this number.\nPhone number %1$s cannot be used because you have used it for activation on a different device.
Verification code expired. Check phone number and request a new verification code.
The permission for location tracking needs to be granted to allow the application to work properly.
You can find more information about why that is in Help.

Were you asked by a Public Health Official to send collected data?

Public Health Officials will use the data based on your consent in conditions of data processing.

Hi, I\'m using Contacts Tracer. Install it too and together we can help fight the spread of COVID\-19. The application collects anonymous data about nearby devices so that Public Health Official can find potentially positive people more easily. The more we are, the better it works. Application can be found at %s.

Are you sure you want to delete the data?

Public Health Officials will not be able to contact potential infected victims in the case you are infected.

After deleting your data, Contacts Tracer will be inactive.

Are you sure you want to delete account?

After deleting account, we can no longer contact you in the case of a potential risk.

If you are the one who gets tested positive, we will not be able to contact anybody you encountered.

Are you sure you want to delete account?

After deleting account, we can no longer contact you in the case of a potential risk.

By deleting your account, only the app on this device will be turned off because you didn't verify your phone number.
Data upload failed. Please try again later.
Your account doesn\'t exist anymore or you were logged out.
All data was deleted and Contacts Tracer is inactive
Thank you for doing your part to fight against the spread of COVID\-19.\n\nPlease coordinate with Public Health Officers to locate people you were in contact with.
Contacts Tracer needs to be active in the background, but the phone is turning it off to save battery.\n\nDisable Battery Saver by pressing \"Disable Battery Saver\" in the settings.
Contacts Tracer needs to be active even when you are not using it
Your phone is automatically turning off some applications when you are not using them to save battery life.
Enable running applications on background in your phone\'s settings. You can find the guide for your phone below.
Were you in contact with anyone today? Check your phone\'s settings. It\'s possible your phone is disabling the application automatically.
Below is a list of signal measurements of nearby devices with Contacts Tracer in the past %d days.
